DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Flap Breast Reconstruction Performed Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of flap breast reconstruction that was carried through to completion.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A type of breast reconstruction in which a flap of tissue is surgically moved from another area of the body to the chest, and formed into a new breast mound._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of breast reconstruction in which a flap of tissue is surgically moved from another area of the body to the chest, and formed into a new breast mound.

Concepts.definition: Breast reconstruction that uses tissues taken from other parts of the individual's body.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/15/22 jk UCSF ISPY-2 AI, released as part of quarterly content review and prior reviews with SMEs.  5-14-19 tt created for Breast surgical therapy module.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A type of breast reconstruction in which a flap of tissue is surgically moved from another area of the body to the chest, and formed into a new breast mound._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.2.2 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002006. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of breast reconstruction in which blood vessels called deep inferior epigastric perforators (DIEP), and the skin and fat connected to them are removed from the lower abdomen and used for reconstruction. Muscle is left in place.

Concepts.definition: A type of breast reconstruction in which blood vessels called deep inferior epigastric perforators (DIEP), and the skin and fat connected to them are removed from the lower abdomen and used for reconstruction. Muscle is left in place.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A grafting procedure where an oval flap of skin, fat, muscle, and blood vessels from your upper back (latissimus dorsi muscle) is used for breast reconstruction.

Concepts.definition: A grafting procedure where an oval flap of skin, fat, muscle, and blood vessels from your upper back (latissimus dorsi muscle) is used for breast reconstruction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A grafting procedure where a piece of tissue, including skin, fat, and all or part of the underlying transverse rectus abdominis muscle are used for breast reconstruction.

Concepts.definition: A grafting procedure where a piece of tissue, including skin, fat, and all or part of the underlying transverse rectus abdominis muscle are used for breast reconstruction.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A type of breast reconstruction in which a flap of tissue is surgically moved from another area of the body to the chest, and formed into a new breast mound.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: Breast reconstruction that uses tissues taken from other parts of the individual's body.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
